phase diagrams.name: Phase Diagrams
phase diagrams.description: Scientific representations of equilibrium between phases in materials; used as a key term in the austenite decomposition study.

kinetics.name: Kinetics
kinetics.description: The study of transformation rates; featured in all three articles addressing phase change speeds.

austenite.name: Austenite
austenite.description: A high-temperature phase of steel that transforms into various phases upon cooling; central to the studies.

steel.name: Steel
steel.description: An alloy of iron and carbon; the primary material investigated in the articles.

modelling.name: Modelling
modelling.description: The process of simulating physical phenomena using mathematical models; a key approach in the studies.

recrystallization.name: Recrystallization
recrystallization.description: A process that reduces dislocation density in deformed metals; the focus of the second article.

carbonitride.name: Carbonitride
carbonitride.description: Compounds precipitated in steels influencing recovery and recrystallization; discussed in the recrystallization study.

CCT diagram.name: CCT Diagram
CCT diagram.description: Continuous cooling transformation diagram; mentioned in the evaluation of phase transformation in medium‐carbon steel.

medium-carbon steel.name: Medium-Carbon Steel
medium-carbon steel.description: Steel with intermediate carbon content; studied in the thermodynamic and kinetic calculation article.

Mathematical Model (C++).name: Mathematical Model (C++)
Mathematical Model (C++).description: A computer-based mathematical model implemented in C++ for simulating the kinetics of phase transformations (ferrite, pearlite, bainite, martensite) in alloyed steels.

Recrystallization Modelling Technology (.name: Recrystallization Modelling Technology (Python)
Recrystallization Modelling Technology (.description: A semi-empirical computer modelling approach implemented in Python for simulating recrystallization kinetics and carbonitride particle precipitation in deformed austenite.

Thermodynamic and Kinetic Calculation Mo.name: Thermodynamic and Kinetic Calculation Model (CALPHAD-based)
Thermodynamic and Kinetic Calculation Mo.description: A computer model based on the CALPHAD method for calculating thermodynamic equilibria and kinetic phase transformations in medium‐carbon alloyed steels.

Austenite Decomposition.name: Austenite Decomposition
Austenite Decomposition.description: The transformation of supercooled austenite into phases such as ferrite, pearlite, bainite, and martensite; modeled and validated in the first article.

Recrystallization.name: Recrystallization
Recrystallization.description: The process of new grain formation in deformed metals, reducing dislocation density; simulated in the second article.

Carbonitride Precipitation.name: Carbonitride Precipitation
Carbonitride Precipitation.description: The nucleation and growth of carbonitride particles in deformed austenite, affecting recovery and recrystallization; a key process in the second study.

Phase Transformation.name: Phase Transformation
Phase Transformation.description: The change in phase composition (e.g., formation of ferrite, bainite, martensite) during cooling or isothermal processes; addressed in the third article.

Ostwald Ripening.name: Ostwald Ripening
Ostwald Ripening.description: A phenomenon where larger particles grow at the expense of smaller ones due to differences in solubility; mentioned in the context of carbonitride particle evolution.

Phase Transformations in Steels.name: Phase Transformations in Steels
Phase Transformations in Steels.description: A subject area focusing on the changes in phase compositions in steels under various thermal and mechanical conditions.

Recrystallization and Recovery in Steels.name: Recrystallization and Recovery in Steels
Recrystallization and Recovery in Steels.description: A research area that deals with the processes of recrystallization and recovery in deformed steels, influenced by precipitated phases.

I. M. Frantsevich Institute for Problems.name: I. M. Frantsevich Institute for Problems in Materials Science
I. M. Frantsevich Institute for Problems.description: A research institute located in Kyiv, Ukraine, where the studies on phase transformations and recrystallization were conducted.

works in.to: I. M. Frantsevich Institute for Problems in Materials Science, N.A.S. of Ukraine

V. V. Kaverynsky.name: V. V. Kaverynsky
V. V. Kaverynsky.description: Co-author of studies on austenite decomposition, phase transformation kinetics, and thermodynamic modelling in steels.

works in.to: I. M. Frantsevich Institute for Problems in Materials Science, N.A.S. of Ukraine

A. I. Trotsan.name: A. I. Trotsan
A. I. Trotsan.description: Co-author of the study on the kinetics of decomposition of supercooled austenite in alloyed steels.

works in.to: I. M. Frantsevich Institute for Problems in Materials Science, N.A.S. of Ukraine

Z. P. Sukhenko.name: Z. P. Sukhenko
Z. P. Sukhenko.description: Co-author involved in all three studies addressing phase transformations, recrystallization, and thermodynamic modelling in steels.

Mathematical Modelling of Kinetics of De.name: Mathematical Modelling of Kinetics of Decomposition of the Supercooled Austenite in Alloyed Steels
Mathematical Modelling of Kinetics of De.description: A study presenting a C++-based mathematical model for simulating the thermodynamics and kinetics of phase transformations (including ferrite, pearlite, bainite, and martensite formation) in alloyed steels; validated with experimental data.

Mathematical Modelling of Primary Recrys.name: Mathematical Modelling of Primary Recrystallization Kinetics and Precipitation of Carbonitride Particles in Steels. II. Recrystallization Kinetics
Mathematical Modelling of Primary Recrys.description: A study employing a Python-based semi-empirical model to simulate recrystallization kinetics and carbonitride particle precipitation in deformed austenite, demonstrating the effect of Nb content on the slowing of recrystallization and recovery.

Evaluation of Computer Model Results for.name: Evaluation of Computer Model Results for Thermodynamic and Kinetic Calculation of Phase Transformation in a Middle-Carbon Alloyed Steel
Evaluation of Computer Model Results for.description: A study using a CALPHAD-based computer model to predict thermodynamic equilibria and kinetic phase transformations (ferrite, bainite, martensite) in medium-carbon steels, with accurate predictions of cooling rates leading to different phases.

Semi-empirical Modelling.name: Semi-empirical Modelling
Semi-empirical Modelling.description: A research method that combines empirical formulas with theoretical principles to simulate recrystallization and precipitation kinetics in steels.

CALPHAD method.name: CALPHAD method
CALPHAD method.description: A computational method for calculating phase diagrams and thermodynamic equilibria in multicomponent systems; used for kinetic and equilibrium estimations in steel transformations.

Grain size.name: Grain size
Grain size.description: A property describing the size of the grains in a polycrystalline material, affecting mechanical strength and transformation kinetics.

Dislocation density.name: Dislocation density
Dislocation density.description: A measure of the number of dislocations per unit volume in a material; influences recovery and recrystallization processes.

Validation with experimental data.name: Validation with Experimental Data
Validation with experimental data.description: The computer models in the studies were verified against experimental results, confirming their reliability for practical applications.

Prediction of cooling rates.name: Prediction of Cooling Rates
Prediction of cooling rates.description: The CALPHAD-based model accurately predicts the cooling rates that lead to the formation of martensite, ferrite, and bainite in medium-carbon steels.

Effect of Nb content.name: Effect of Nb Content
Effect of Nb content.description: The simulations demonstrate that increasing niobium (Nb) content slows down recrystallization and recovery processes due to enhanced precipitation of carbonitride particles.
